page.title: 09KINGSMEAD COMPREHENSIVE
page.content: Kingsmead is Wiveliscombes largest single employer.There are 29 full-time and 4 part-time teachers (with a choice of 15 stand-ins) 10 cleaners,8 cooks, 3 secretaries,2 technicians,2 groundsmen,1 librarian,5 dinner supervisors making a total of 66 . The school,situated at Lambrook,opened in 1953 with 300 pupils from age 11 transfered from the all age schools. The raising of the school leaving age in 1973 brought a new block whilst more funds were devoted to the school becoming comprehensive in 1974. The catchment area is large including Bishops Lydeard and Bagborough in the Quantock foothills,isolated hamlets and farms in the Brendons and settlements in and along the Vale of Taunton.Nearly 3/4 of pupils travel in by bus,some choosing to come from Wellington and across the Devon border
